private_information: I observe and can manipulate the left and middle stacks.
I can pick up one block at a time and only the top block of a stack.
robot1.goal: Help observe and record a consistent sequence of state changes for part of the BlocksWorld instance.

private_information: I observe and can manipulate the right stacks.
I enforce the standard BlocksWorld constraints when proposing moves.
robot2.goal: Help observe and record a consistent sequence of state changes for part of the BlocksWorld instance.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' observations and produce a single PDDL domain and problem encoding the instance and the derived final arrangement, targeting the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: There are eight labeled blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
Standard BlocksWorld rules apply: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Initial arrangement: A is on C, C is on G, G is on the table, B is on the table, F is on B, H is on the table, D is on H, E is on D.

An ordered sequence of actions was executed: unstack(E, D), putdown(E), pickup(E), putdown(E), pickup(E), stack(E, F), unstack(D, H), stack(D, A), pickup(H), stack(H, D), unstack(H, D), stack(H, D), unstack(E, F), putdown(E), unstack(H, D), putdown(H), pickup(H), stack(H, E), unstack(D, A), stack(D, H).
Derive the final arrangement after applying the actions to the initial configuration.

plan.system_prompt: You are an agent that observes and records block manipulations. Provide a concise local sequence of state changes or planned moves and report any ambiguities or missing context.
plan.prompt: Your name is robot1. Using the public information and your private information produce a step-by-step local trace describing the observed moves you are responsible for or can verify. Do not emit PDDL. If some information is missing, do not assume it.

plan.system_prompt: You are an agent that reasons about stack configurations and consistency in BlocksWorld. Provide a concise local sequence of state changes or planned moves and point out any inconsistencies.
plan.prompt: Your name is robot2. Using the public information and your private information produce a step-by-step local trace describing the observed moves you are responsible for or can verify. Do not emit PDDL. If some information is missing, do not assume it.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct if relevant.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Integrate the observations or local plans provided by the agents and any public information to produce a single consistent BlocksWorld PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the given initial state and the final arrangement derived from the executed action sequence. Target the FastDownwards planner. If agents' inputs conflict or are partial, resolve them explicitly and document any assumptions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
